figure.note: Pen and ink drawing: gateDespite some differences, WG's drawing bears similarities to David Roberts's illustration in Thomas Roscoe, The Tourist in Spain. Granada (London, 1835), pp. 116-17: 'The Casa del Carbon'. The similarities include this title, which WG also uses.
figure.label: CASA DEL CARBONi.e. Corral del Carbón (Coal Yard; 'Casa del Carbón' would be Coal House), Granada. WG's drawing represents the building before twentieth-century restoration.

div.ab: The Casa del Carbon is nearly in centre of City, between the Zacatin & the Moorish bridge. close to the Darro, the Post house for Couriers & Cavaleriera. Built by Abu Alhamar. Some of The Horses of the breed of Nejdi some of Dongola – The Casa del Carbon not unlike a jewish house.Summary of Roscoe, Tourist in Spain. Granada, pp. 117-20. Same observations in same order, though WG has replaced Roscoe's 'high-bred corredores' (runners, i.e. horses) with 'Couriers & Cavaleriera'. By the latter, WG must mean 'caballería', cavalry horses.
